items.sentence: You can\'t really expect to get better at French if you don\'t study.
I won\'t go to all the meetings, but I\'ll try to go to some of them.
My leg\'s gone to sleep, so whatever you do, don\'t touch my leg now.
Tom pretended that he didn\'t care that Mary was going out with John.
Tom just couldn\'t resist teasing Mary about the way she was dressed.
After polishing his shoes, Tom brushed his teeth and combed his hair.
Just because Tom said he didn\'t have a key doesn\'t mean it\'s true.
I think I\'ve found something that you might be interested in seeing.
I can\'t help but think that maybe someday you and I\'ll get married.
At this time, I\'m not sure whether I\'ll go to college or get a job.
Do you think there\'s any chance that Tom knows Mary\'s phone number?
Tom speaks French with his grandparents and English with his parents.
Tom stood in the corner of the room with a gin and tonic in his hand.
Tom and Mary rented a room in one of Boston\'s most luxurious hotels.
I\'ve been thinking it might be fun to go to Australia and visit Tom.
I\'ll bet you thirty dollars I can get to Boston faster than you can.
It\'ll take some time, but eventually Tom will be able to walk again.
Let\'s discuss the problem and see if we can come up with a solution.
Could you please tell me again when the meeting is supposed to start?
I can\'t go to Australia with you because I don\'t have enough money.
